title: Add Google research area to writing tab and investigate 9-word limit bug

requirements.summary: Add a Google research area component to the WritingPage that allows students to search Google directly from the writing interface
acceptanceCriteria: A Google research section is visible on the WritingPage
Students can enter search queries and view results or be redirected to Google search
The research area integrates seamlessly with the existing sidebar layout alongside dictionary and thesaurus tools
The interface is age-appropriate for grade 4 students

file_operations.description: Create a Google search component with a search input field and a button that opens search results in a new tab using Google's search URL. Style it consistently with DictionaryTool and ThesaurusTool components using Card, Input, and Button from shadcn/ui. Include appropriate labels and placeholders for grade 4 students.

Import and integrate the GoogleSearchTool component into the existing sidebar layout alongside DictionaryTool and ThesaurusTool. Position it within the same scrollable area to maintain the current visual hierarchy and ensure the sidebar accommodates all three research tools without layout issues.

requirements.summary: Investigate and fix the production deployment issue causing the WritingPage textarea to enforce a 9-word limit instead of the intended 2000-word maximum
acceptanceCriteria: The live production version of WritingPage enforces a 2000-word maximum limit
Users can type up to 2000 words without being prevented from entering more text
The word count display shows 'X / 2000' format correctly
The 9-word limit bug is completely resolved in production

file_operations.description: Review the textarea's maxLength attribute, onChange handler, and any conditional logic that might prevent text input beyond 9 words. Ensure the textarea is not using a hardcoded character limit or incorrectly applying the word count. Verify that the word count validation logic allows input up to 2000 words and only shows a warning or disables further input after that threshold. Remove any erroneous constraints that might be causing the 9-word limitation.

Review the word counting implementation to ensure it correctly splits text on whitespace and counts words accurately. Verify there are no off-by-one errors, hardcoded limits, or logic that would cause premature truncation at 9 words. Ensure the hook returns the correct word count for validation in WritingPage.
